## Quarto {background-image=images/bg.jpg background-size=contain background-opacity='0.5'}

::: incremental
- enables you to weave together content and executable code into a finished presentation.
- makes the process of creating and collaborating on scientific and technical documents dramatically better.
- is Posit’s attempt to bring R Markdown to everyone! Unlike R Markdown, Quarto doesn’t have a dependency or requirement for R.
:::

## Integrated workflow {background-image=images/bg.jpg background-size=contain background-opacity='0.5'}

R Markdown and Quarto allow for the seamless integration of narrative text, raw data, and executable code in a single document.

+ [Simpler syntax with Markdown](https://quarto.org/docs/authoring/markdown-basics.html)
+ You can hide or show your codes, hide or show results, choose to or not to evaluate codes

## Dynamic updating {background-image=images/bg.jpg background-size=contain background-opacity='0.5'}

Results, tables, and figures update automatically when the underlying data changes, eliminating manual editing errors and ensuring the final paper remains up to date with the analysis.

## Dynamic updating {background-image=images/bg.jpg background-size=contain background-opacity='0.5'}

```{r}
#| echo: TRUE
#| code-line-numbers: "|1-4|6-8|10-15|1,4"
# load data
library("kableExtra")
data(iris)
iris2 <- iris[4:6, c(1, 3, 2, 4, 5)]

# calculations
mean_sepal_length <- mean(iris2$Sepal.Length)
mean_sepal_width <- mean(iris2$Sepal.Width)

# format into a pretty table
names(iris2) <- gsub('[.].+', '', names(iris2))
rownames(iris2) <- NULL
iris_table <- kable(iris2, booktabs = TRUE) %>%
  add_header_above(c("Length" = 2, "Width" = 2, " " = 1)) %>%
  add_header_above(c("Measurements" = 4, "More attributes" = 1))
```


## Dynamic updating {background-image=images/bg.jpg background-size=contain background-opacity='0.5'}

The means of sepal length and sepal width are `r round(mean_sepal_length,2)` and `r round(mean_sepal_width,2)`, respectively.

```{r}
#| echo: FALSE
#| label: tbl-letters
#| tbl-cap: "Iris Data"
iris_table
```

## Multi-format outputs {background-image=images/bg.jpg background-size=contain background-opacity='0.5'}

One source file can be rendered into professional PDFs, Word documents or Tex files for collaborators, interactive HTML reports and presentations, as well as into beamer or PowerPoint. 

::: incremental
1. Specify the formats in your YAML.
2. Use the terminal: `quarto render your_qmd.qmd --to beamer`. 
:::

## Automated elements {background-image=images/bg.jpg background-size=contain background-opacity='0.5'}

Complex tasks such as cross-referencing, bibliography management, plots and table formatting are handled programmatically, which maintains consistency throughout long documents.

::: incremental
1. Citations: According to @klein
2. Cross-referencing: See @tbl-letters.
3. Extensions for journals (e.g., [JASA](https://github.com/quarto-journals/jasa#readme))
:::
